page.title: 17FACTS ABOUT LIFE IN WITTON
page.content: The village of Witton is cut in two by the A47. Witton Church has a lych gate. The village P.O. is part of somebody's house. There used to be 3 men to do deliveries but now that is done from Blofield.The P.O.house used to be a{toll-house}called the Turnpike.There was a{milestone}outside and the tramps would rest there while walking to the{workhouse}at Lingwood.Men going to the{1st World {War}went past on route marches and used to stop for some water.The house opposite the P.O. was a pub called "Witton Honest Man"until 1895.There was also a mill on Mill Lane until 1900.The man in the P.O.told us his father went to a{"Dame School"}for 1d.a week. The P.O.house has a well in the garden and they still get water from it.The man could remember when the roads were cart-tracks.
